content:
Thanks to @Katie Dagon, much of the Zoom chat at the town hall today was captured and recorded:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fENlFKXu32XeE49OWHwoMJgizXnFmzEbUGK5i39IIdw/edit?usp=sharing

Please feel free to add your thoughts to that document or respond to this thread here.
The town hall was also recorded, and we can share that video with the community
Thank you, @Katie Dagon! Having tried to do something similar in our Python Tutorial seminars, I know it is a Herculean task.
Perhaps we can write a summary blog post on the town hall and feedback we received? Then we can share the video and chat links in the blog post.

I can try to group things together? Might be good to "schedule" discussions in these chat platforms with subsequent posts as well... basically ensure that we bring up points from today's town hall later down the road so people don't forget some of the discussion
I tried to organize the google doc into topics of discussion
Sounds good - I can draft something up and share it with you all? Basically highlighting main points and discussion (without the names)
It might be good to add at least the drafted mission statement/vision to an about page too - @Katie Dagon could you send the presentation so I can incorporate some of the images as well?

It might be good to add at least the drafted mission statement/vision to an about page too - Katie Dagon could you send the presentation so I can incorporate some of the images as well?

Sure I just shared the google slides with you
